info.title: Case Service
info.description:
Cases are records of service or support requests from an account or individual customer used to track interactions with the requestor. Cases also record details like how much time has passed since the case was created, what actions were taken to resolve the issue, priority or associated products, and much more.

Use this API to view, create, and manage your cases.

servers.description: Example of server url is https://my1234567.crm.cloud.sap

get.description: Specify query parameters to return desired case records from the system.

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Show only the first n cases.

parameters.name: $search
parameters.description: Search for a string within case.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: Indicates if count of cases to be returned.

parameters.name: $query
parameters.description: Indicates the query to be used by case service.

401.description:
Unauthorized.

This error is caused when the request has not been applied because there are no valid authentication credentials for the target resource.

403.description:
Forbidden.

This client error code indicates that the server understood the request but refuses to authorize it.

500.description:
Internal Server Error.

Failed to query cases.

post.description: Send case information to the system to create a new case entity.

400.description:
Bad Request.

The server cannot process the request due to a client error. For example, an invalid request.

401.description:
Unauthorized.

This error is caused when the request has not been applied because there are no valid authentication credentials for the target resource.

403.description:
Forbidden.

This client error code indicates that the server understood the request but refuses to authorize it.

500.description:
Internal Server Error.

Failed to create the case.

get.description: Query the system for a specific case using the case ID.

401.description:
Unauthorized.

This error is caused when the request has not been applied because there are no valid authentication credentials for the target resource.

403.description:
Forbidden

This client error code indicates that the server understood the request but refuses to authorize it.

500.description:
Internal Server Error.

Failed to read the case.

put.description: Add attributes to a specific case by ID.

400.description:
Bad Request.

The server cannot process the request due to a client error. For example, an invalid request.

401.description:
Unauthorized.

This error is caused when the request has not been applied because there are no valid authentication credentials for the target resource.

403.description:
Forbidden.

This client error code indicates that the server understood the request but refuses to authorize it.

500.description:
Internal Server Error.

Failed to update the case.

patch.description: Update case attributes in the system.

parameters.name: If-Match
parameters.description: Used for conflict management when a consumer tries to update a resource. This parameter checks if the state of the resource known to the client (etag) matches the state on the server and if true, allows the update to continue.

200.description:
Case updated.

The case was updated successfully.
